abstract_summ: In order to launch both containment and mitigation measures, each country requires accurate estimates of COVID-19 incidence as such preparedness allows agencies to plan efficient resource allocation and design control strategies.Meanwhile, the developed model can serve as a public health tool to control the current outbreak and can be used to anticipate effective measures should a second wave re-emerge in Kuwait.This analysis can aid in highlighting the most and least significant public policies in minimizing a country’s COVID-19 mortality rate.With this offset in mind, we identify anomalous countries in the progression from COVID-19 cases to deaths.The total number of clusters and individual countries’ cluster memberships are algorithmically determined.
title_summ: Real-time tracking and forecasting of the of COVID-19 outbreak in Kuwait: a mathematical modeling studyAn Adaptive, Interacting, Cluster-Based Model Accurately Predicts the Transmission Dynamics of COVID-19Time-dependent and time-independent SIR models applied to the COVID-19 outbreak in Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Mexico and South AfricaCluster-based dual evolution for multivariate time series: Analyzing COVID-19
title_abstract_phrases: Meanwhile, the developed model can serve as a public health tool to control the current outbreak and can be used to anticipate effective measures should a second wave re-emerge in Kuwait.Time-dependent and time-independent SIR models applied to the COVID-19 outbreak in Argentina, Brazil, Colombia, Mexico and South AfricaWe consider the SIR epidemiological model applied to the evolution of COVID-19 with two approaches.In order to launch both containment and mitigation measures, each country requires accurate estimates of COVID-19 incidence as such preparedness allows agencies to plan efficient resource allocation and design control strategies.This analysis can aid in highlighting the most and least significant public policies in minimizing a country’s COVID-19 mortality rate.With this offset in mind, we identify anomalous countries in the progression from COVID-19 cases to deaths.
